intro: Gomphia erythrocalyx, commonly known as the red-calyx gomphia, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive red-colored calyx that encases its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other umbelliferous plants. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
